Package com.wm.xmldata

The XmlData package contains a collection of classes used to create and update an XmlData Infoset.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    XmlDataCursor
    See glossary of terms
    XmlDataTreeCursor
    See glossary of terms
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    XmlData
    See glossary of terms
    XmlDataAnyTag
    The XmlDataAnyTag class constructs an XmlData any-tag from its constituent parts.
    XmlDataAttributeTag
    The XmlDataAttributeTag class constructs an XmlData attribute-tag from its constituent parts.
    XmlDataConstants
    XmlDataConstants provides a collection of shortcuts for the lengthy names used by the XmlData packages.
    XmlDataContentTag
    This class is a common superclass for the XmlDataTags that may appear in content models.
    XmlDataCopy
    XmlDataCopy implements a structured copying utility for XmlData infosets.
    XmlDataCursorImpl  
    XmlDataElementTag
    The XmlDataElementTag class constructs an XmlData element-tag from its constituent parts.
    XmlDataGroupTag
    The XmlDataGroupTag class constructs an XmlData group-tag from its constituent parts.
    XmlDataIteratorTag
    The XmlDataIteratorTag class constructs an XmlData iterator-tag from its only constituent part, which is just an ncName.
    XmlDataMap
    The XmlDataMap class allows direct manipulation of fields in an XmlData object without the use of cursors.
    XmlDataPath
    This helper class facilitates the encoding or decoding of an XmlData path as a String literal.
    XmlDataSubstitutionTag
    The XmlDataSubstitutionTag class constructs an XmlData substitution-tag from its constituent parts.
    XmlDataTag
    This iNs the base construction class for all XmlData tags.
    XmlDataTreeCursorImpl  
    XmlDataTypeTag
    The XmlDataTypeTag class constructs an XmlData type-tag from its constituent parts.
    XmlNamespaceMap
    This class maintains a mapping between prefixes and namespace URIs.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    XmlDataException
    This class is the base class for all exceptions thrown by the XmlDataFeaure
    XmlDataException.ArgumentError
    This exception is thrown when XmlData method encounters an argument that is not valid for the operation.
    XmlDataException.FormatError
    This exception is thrown when XmlData processing encounters an XmlData instance that is not in proper XmlData format.
    XmlDataException.ImproperDocumentType
    This Exception is thrown when an XmlDataMap is created using an inappropriate Document Type.
    XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange
    This exception is thrown when when an attempt is made to fetch or insert a repeating value beyond the last repeating value.
    XmlDataException.IndexRequired
    This exception is thrown when a method is invoked on an entry with repeating values, but no index is supplied to the method.
    XmlDataException.IndirectItemError
    This exception is thrown when the instance (XmlData) document or the tag specified on the invoking method does not contain the indirect value tag (e.g.
    XmlDataException.MemberConflict
    This Exception is thrown when an incompatible object type is assigned to an array.
    XmlDataException.ModelConflict
    This Exception is thrown when the Document Type used in an XmlDataMap is incompatible with the existing instance (XmlData) document, making it impossible to find the correct insertion point for new content.
    XmlDataException.ReadOnlyWorkspace
    This Exception is thrown when attempting to create a global namespace component when the workspace is read-only.
    XmlDataException.TagAndContentConflict
    This exception is thrown when an incompatible value is assigned to an entry with a particular tag type.
    XmlDataException.TagConflict
    This exception is thrown when an operation cannot be performed for the tag type.
    XmlDataException.TagSyntaxError
    This exception is thrown when a path has a syntax error
    XmlDataException.UndefinedIterator
    This Exception is thrown when an XmlDataCopy output path step encounters an undefined iterator.
    XmlDataException.UnknownField
    This exception is thrown when attempting to use a Field that is not defined by the Document Type associated with the map.
    XmlDataException.UnpositionedCursor
    This Exception is thrown when a method is invoked on an unpositioned XmlDataCursor and that method is only permitted when the cursor is positioned.
    XmlDataException.UnsupportedType
    This exception is thrown when an unsupported object type is inserted into XmlData content.

Package com.wm.xmldata Description

The XmlData package contains a collection of classes used to create and update an XmlData Infoset.

The XmlData class implements static methods that assist in the creation and manipulation of an XmlData infoset.

The XmlDataCursor and XmlDataTreeCursor classes provide a means to navigate through an XmlDat Infoset, much the way that IDataCursor provides a means to navigate over a raw IData instance. Use the XmlData.getXmlDataCursor(com.wm.data.IData) method or the XmlData.getXmlDataTreeCursor(com.wm.data.IData) method to obtain the appropriate cursor type.

The XmlDataCursor allows navigation by tag-object-pair within a single level of an XmlData Infoset. When the cursor is advanced from the current position, it advances to another tag-value=pair. In order to access an individual value from a repeating value, it is necessary to specify an index. In order to access the children of a complex-value, it is necessary to obtain the complex content, obtain an XMlDataCursor on the content, and then navigate to the desired child element.

The XMlDataTreeCursor extends the concept of an XmlDataCursor in two ways. First, it maintains a current index so that advancing the cursor to the next item actually increments the current index to the next item in a repeating value, or to the next tag-object-pair if already positioned on the last repeating value or only value associated with the current tag. Second, methods such as XmlDataTreeCursor.firstChild() are hierarchy-aware and automatically position to the first child item of complex content. XmlDataTreeCursor provides an essentially flattened view of the XmlData infoset so that it loosely resembles a DOM-based infoset.

The XmlDataTreeCursor methods are generally a superset of the XmlDataCursor methods. They also generally have one additional feature: if the index is not specified for when the current tag is a repeating value, the current item is accessed. The current-item may be thought of as index into the repeating values stored at the current position. The XmlData tag classes facilitate the creation of XmlData infoset tags. They relieve the user from knowing the specific details of tag construction. The various XmlData methods typically expect one of these objects rather than a raw String, even though the tags in an XmlData infoset are raw Strings.

  • XmlDataElementTag - create and manipulate element-tags
  • XmlDataGroupTag - create and manipulate group-tags
  • XmlDataAnyTag - create and manipulate any-tags
  • XmlDataSubstitutionTag - create and manipulate substitution-tags
  • XmlDataAttributeTag - create and manipulate attribute-tags
There are also tags that are used only by helper classes and never exist in an infoset: *
  • XmlDataTypeTag - create and manipulate type-tags
  • XmlDataIteratorTag - create and manipulate iterator-tags

The XmlDataMap class is used to access an XmlData infoset using a Document Type schema. This relieves the user from tedious programming needed to update an infoset subject to a prescribed Document Type structure. A map-path (similar to a Flow Map path) is used to identify data rather than coding a series of navigation steps. The XmlDataPath class is used to assist in the creations of XmlDat paths.

The XmlDataCopy class is used to selectively copy portions of a source XmlData infoset to a target XmlData infoset. Paths using symbolic iterators allow the use to specify wild cards for individual steps in a path.

On an operating Integration Server, the XmlData infoset can also be created using the public service pub.xmldata:domNodeToXmlData and the XmlData infoset can be converted to an XML String using pub.xmldata:xmlDataToXMLString

The XmlNamespaceMap class is used to define associations between prefixes and namespaces. These associations are used by various helpers when creating or parsing tags, paths, and xmldata Document definitions. Prefixes are never used in XmlData infosets.
